com.slightlyloony.blog.templates.sources

Class RootSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.slightlyloony.blog.templates.sources.data.DatumBase
      • com.slightlyloony.blog.templates.sources.SourceBase
        • com.slightlyloony.blog.templates.sources.RootSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Datum, Source
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HomePageRootSource

    public abstract class RootSource
extends SourceBase
implements Source
    Instances of this class are the root source suitable for use as the data source input to a template. Each context in which a root source is needed extends this class.
    Author:
    Tom Dilatush tom@dilatush.com

    • Method Detail

      • addCommon

        protected static void addCommon(java.util.List<DatumDef> _data)
        Adds the data that are common to all root sources.
        Parameters:
        _data - the superclass' list of datum definitions

      • getDatum

        public Datum getDatum(Path _path)
        Returns the datum at the given path. If any of the path parts evaluate incorrectly, then an error message is returned as a string datum. Otherwise, the datum identified by the last part of the path is returned.
        Parameters:
        _path - the path to the desired datum
        Returns:
        the datum desired, or an explanatory string datum if there was a problem

      • getValue

        public java.lang.Object getValue(Path _path)
        Returns the value at the given hierarchical indices. Each index other than the last index is the index for the source returned from the preceding index lookup (or the root source in the case of the first index). The last index looks up the returned value on the last source.
        Parameters:
        _path - the path to the desired value
        Returns:
        the value desired, or an explanatory string value if there was a problem
